CONCLUSION: Preliminary objection joinded to merits and dismissed (six-month period);Violation of Art. 6-1;Not necessary to examine Art. 6 (length of the proceedings);Remainder inadmissible;Pecuniary damage - financial award;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in the town of GPE , the GPE region .

CARDINAL . In DATE ORG charged the applicant ( a former inspector of the GPE city market ) with corruption , and ordered his detention on remand . In DATE the applicant was released against his undertaking not to abscond . In DATE his case was closed given the lack of any corpus delicti . This decision was subsequently quashed by ORG and the investigation was reopened . On DATE the criminal proceedings against the applicant were ultimately terminated given the absence of any corpus delicti .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant instituted proceedings against ORG of GPE , seeking monetary compensation for unlawful prosecution .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( hereafter “ the ORG ” ) granted this claim and awarded the applicant UAH CARDINAL,CARDINAL . In assessing the amount of moral compensation , the court took account of medical certificates attesting to the fact that subsequent to his release the applicant had suffered a nervous breakdown . On DATE this judgment became final and binding .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG lodged an supervisory appeal with the ORG of ORG against the judgment of DATE . On DATE the court , sitting in a closed session in the presence of a prosecutor , quashed this judgment and remitted the case for a new consideration .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , in the resumed proceedings , allowed the applicant 's claim . Having regard to the medical documents , the forensic psychological report and statements from a number of witnesses , the court found , inter alia , that the applicant 's nervous breakdown had been caused by his detention , and ordered ORG to pay the applicant LAW in moral and material damages . On DATE this judgment acquired legal force .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG challenged this judgment under the new cassation procedure ( see “ Relevant domestic law ” , paragraph CARDINAL below ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG declared unconstitutional LAW on the State Budget CARDINAL , which provided that compensation for unlawful criminal prosecutions was to be deducted from the funds allocated to the relevant law - enforcement agencies . ORG decided that the relevant amounts should be paid directly from ORG held by ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE a judge of ORG returned the prosecutor 's appeal to ORG , indicating that it had to examine the issue of the reopening of the proceedings on the ground of new circumstances .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , on a request from ORG , reopened the proceedings in the case due to new circumstances , namely the annulment of LAW on the State Budget CARDINAL by the aforementioned decision of ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG partly allowed the applicant 's claim , ordering ORG to pay him UAH CARDINAL in compensation for unlawful prosecution . The court held that the criminal proceedings against the applicant had been unlawful but found the claim for moral damages excessive :

“ With respect to the remainder of the claims [ the court notes that ] the claimant has failed ... to provide any corroborating evidence ; nor did he submit to the court any calculation of the amount of compensation for moral damage .
No reliable link could be seen between the claimant 's nervous breakdown and his criminal prosecution and arrest . ”
The applicant appealed .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld this judgment , indicating , inter alia , that , according to the forensic psychological report , the nervous breakdown , suffered by the applicant in DATE , could result either from his unlawful detention or from his general poor state of health , thus finding that the amount of UAH CARDINAL,CARDINAL constituted sufficient compensation for damages suffered due to unlawful prosecution .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant 's request for leave to appeal under the cassation procedure .

CARDINAL . On an unknown date in DATE the applicant applied to ORG for compulsory enforcement of the DATE judgment . The warrant of execution was on several occasions sent to ORG of ORG . However on DATE the enforcement proceedings were suspended pending the outcome of the prosecution 's extraordinary appeal ( paragraph CARDINAL above ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG refused the applicant 's request to initiate the enforcement proceedings for the judgment of DATE , ruling that its enforcement was time barred . The court found that LAW envisaged that the writs of execution should be lodged with the relevant authority within DATE after the judgment acquired legal force . The judgment in the applicant 's case had become final on DATE upon the decision of ORG , whereas the applicant requested the issuance of the writ of execution on DATE , i.e. after the expiry of the statutory limitation . The applicant did not appeal against this decision .
CARDINAL . The judgment of DATE has not been enforced to date .
CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law is summarised in the judgment of PERSON v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL , § § CARDINAL , DATE ) .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL - CARDINAL of the Code provides that , having examined the request for reopening of the case on the ground of new circumstances , the competent court delivers the ruling , whereby it either quashes the relevant judgment or rejects the above request . If the judgment is quashed the case is examined on the merits according to the general rules contained in this Code .
CARDINAL . The Constitutional Court held :
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of the PERSON are read as follows :
Article CARDINAL
Persons having the right to lodge a cassation appeal

“ Parties and other persons who participate in court proceedings , and the prosecutor and other persons who have not participated in the proceedings in which the court has decided on their rights and obligations , may lodge a cassation appeal against judgments and rulings adopted by the court of first instance , only in relation to a violation of the substantive or procedural law and rulings and judgments of an appeal court .
The basis for such an appeal is the incorrect application of the norms of substantive law or infringement of the norms of procedural law . ”
Section CARDINAL
The deadlines for lodging an application for annulment

“ The deadline for lodging an application by the prosecutor is DATE from the date of delivery of the ruling or judgment of ORG , or DATE from the date of delivery of the ruling or judgment of the court of first instance , if these rulings or decisions have not been appealed against . ”
LAW . Transitional Provisions
“ CARDINAL . This PERSON shall enter into force as from DATE .
CARDINAL . Laws and other normative acts adopted before this PERSON entered into force are effective in so far as their provisions do not conflict with LAW and this PERSON .
CARDINAL . Appeals in civil cases lodged before DATE shall be considered in accordance with the procedure adopted for the examination of appeals against local courts ' decisions .

CARDINAL . Protests against judicial decisions lodged before DATE shall be sent to ORG of GPE for consideration in accordance with the procedure for consideration of cassation appeals ( касаційних скарг ) .

CARDINAL . Decisions that have been adopted and have entered into force before DATE can be appealed against within DATE in accordance with the procedure for consideration of cassation appeals ( to ORG ) . ”
